page.title: 05A MODERN DAIRY FARM ASHWELL
page.content: Fewer people work on farms now, machines have replaced men. Two men look afer two hundred cows, milking twenty at a time in a modern milking parlour. Farm buildings are no longer beautiful they are built machine size, not man size. They are made so they can be used for a variety of purposes, a modern farmer may have to change to stay in business. The cows are black and white Freisians. They eat a lot of silage.There are two cows per acre because the grass is so good. It is made into silage without needing additives.It is put under black polythene sheets.The fields in Aswell were never small because the Enclosure Acts were comparatively late nevertheless some fields have been combined. Snake's Piece, Brick Kiln and Little Ten Acre have been made into one and a line of trees removed.
